channel.title: I need help. I'm begging you
channel.description: I accidentally set my friends account on my computer to admin. It deleted the admin profile. He forgot the password, and so do I. All I have is the guest account. What do I do?

item.title: I need help. I'm begging you
item.dc:creator: @mvp566 mvp566
item.description:
@mvp566 wrote:

press it once, bassiclly you need to start your computer in safe mode try F10 also… when you get to the correct screen just use normal safe mode nothing else…[br][size=1]Posted on: February 10, 2007, 11:39:26 PM[/size][hr]

[center]To start the computer in safe mode[/center]

1. You should print these instructions before continuing. They will not be available after you shut your computer down in step 2.

2. Click Start and then click Shut Down.

3. In the drop-down list of the Shut Down Windows dialog box, click Restart, and then click OK.

4. As your computer restarts but before Windows launches, press F8.
On a computer that is configured for booting to multiple operating systems, you can press F8 when the boot menu appears.

5. Use the arrow keys to highlight the appropriate safe mode option, and then press ENTER.

  1. If you have a dual-boot or multiple-boot system, choose the installation that you need to access using the arrow keys, and then press ENTER.

Read full topic

ok when your computer is starting up (like the very beggining loading part)(black screen or w.e on windows) press F8 now enter with the account “administrator” is shouldent have a password now change the pass of the other 2 accounts VIA the control panel.
